intro: Stranvaesia amphidoxa var. amphileia, commonly known as the red-flowered evergreen heath, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves and bears showy, tubular red flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and requires a cool, humid environment to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
